story.book

Class ReadingFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Fragment
      • story.book.ReadingFragment

  • public class ReadingFragment
extends Fragment
    ReadingFragment is the interface users can use to read story fragments. If the current fragment being read is not an ending fragment, the end of the page will have buttons which will allow users to pick a DecisionBranch progress to the following story fragment in the story.
    Author:
    Jessica Surya

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void displayFragment(StoryFragment SF, View rootView)
      displayFragment() displays all text illustrations as views and decision branches as buttons by getting them from the containing fragment and formatting them by calling formatView and formatButton respectively.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Button> formatButton(java.util.ArrayList<DecisionBranch> db, Context c)
      formatButton() creates a button with the corresponding decision branch text for each decision branch in an array list of decision branches.
      private void formatView(java.util.ArrayList<View> v)
      formatView() (FOR TEXTVIEWS ONLY) formats illustration textViews in an array list by changing: - text size (20) - text color (black) - padding on the left side
      View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater, ViewGroup container, Bundle savedInstanceState) 
      private View.OnClickListener setListener(Button b, int destinationID) 
      void update()

    • Method Detail

      • displayFragment

        private void displayFragment(StoryFragment SF,
                             View rootView)
        displayFragment() displays all text illustrations as views and decision branches as buttons by getting them from the containing fragment and formatting them by calling formatView and formatButton respectively.
        Parameters:
        StoryFragment - StoryFragment object
        View - where illustrations will be displayed

      • formatButton

        private java.util.ArrayList<Button> formatButton(java.util.ArrayList<DecisionBranch> db,
                                                 Context c)
        formatButton() creates a button with the corresponding decision branch text for each decision branch in an array list of decision branches. This returns method an array list of buttons.
        Parameters:
        DecisionBranch - the decision branches associated with the fragment
        Context - the context where the button will be displayed
        Returns:
        an custom ArrayList

      • formatView

        private void formatView(java.util.ArrayList<View> v)
        formatView() (FOR TEXTVIEWS ONLY) formats illustration textViews in an array list by changing: - text size (20) - text color (black) - padding on the left side
        Parameters:
        View - illustrations displayed as Views
